fine_dining.name: Cheval Blanc by Peter Knogl (Grand Hotel Les Trois Rois)
signature_dishes: Seasonal tasting menus focusing on intense flavors and high-quality products, particularly seafood.
fine_dining.atmosphere: Supremely elegant, classic dining room in Basel's grandest hotel, overlooking the Rhine
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book months in advance, especially for weekends or window tables. Strict dress code.
fine_dining.local_tips: Basel's pinnacle of fine dining, consistently ranked among the world's best. Expect flawless execution and service.

fine_dining.name: Restaurant Stucki - Tanja Grandits
signature_dishes: Imaginative tasting menus known for vibrant colors, contrasting textures, and complex spice aromas.
fine_dining.atmosphere: Elegant villa setting in the Bruderholz residential district, modern and bright interior
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book well in advance. Offers both multi-course tasting menus and a more concise business lunch.
fine_dining.local_tips: Unique culinary style focused on aromas and spices, led by one of Switzerland's most celebrated female chefs.

fine_dining.name: roots
signature_dishes: Creative tasting menus where vegetables take center stage, often accompanied by fish or meat elements.
Known for innovative techniques and beautiful presentation.
fine_dining.atmosphere: Modern, stylish setting in the Bachletten district, near the Zoo. Relaxed fine dining.
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book ahead. Offers surprise tasting menus of varying lengths (6-10 courses). Specify dietary needs.
fine_dining.local_tips: Exceptional vegetable-forward cuisine that pushes boundaries. Excellent non-alcoholic pairings available.

fine_dining.name: Bel Etage (im Teufelhof)
signature_dishes: Seasonal tasting menus and à la carte options featuring high-quality ingredients and refined execution.
fine_dining.atmosphere: Elegant yet artistic setting within the Teufelhof cultural guesthouse, split into several intimate rooms
fine_dining.booking_tips: Part of a complex including a hotel, theatre, and another restaurant (Atelier). Good value for its Michelin star.
fine_dining.local_tips: Reliable fine dining in a culturally rich setting. Combines art, history, and gastronomy.

casual_dining.name: Restaurant Löwenzorn
signature_dishes: Zürcher Geschnetzeltes (Sliced veal in cream sauce) with Rösti
casual_dining.atmosphere: Historic guild hall atmosphere with traditional decor, beautiful courtyard garden in summer
casual_dining.booking_tips: Charming historic building near Marktplatz. Courtyard is highly sought after in warm weather.
casual_dining.local_tips: Classic Basel institution for traditional Swiss food in a historic setting. Great ambiance, especially in the garden.

casual_dining.name: Fischerstube
casual_dining.atmosphere: Lively, traditional brewpub atmosphere with copper brewing tanks, wooden tables
casual_dining.booking_tips: Basel's oldest microbrewery. Try a flight of their Ueli beers. Good value food.
casual_dining.local_tips: Authentic brewpub experience popular with locals. Great beer and solid, reasonably priced food.

casual_dining.name: Ufer7
casual_dining.atmosphere: Modern, rustic-chic interior, popular terrace directly on the Rhine
casual_dining.best_time: Lunch or Dinner (Terrace best in summer)
casual_dining.booking_tips: Fantastic location on the Kleinbasel Rhine promenade. Known for sharing plates and city-beach vibe.
casual_dining.local_tips: Trendy spot with great Rhine views, perfect for drinks or a meal, especially in summer. Focuses on local/regional products.

casual_dining.name: Volkshaus Basel Brasserie
casual_dining.atmosphere: Stylish, designed by Herzog & de Meuron, beautiful courtyard garden, classic brasserie feel with modern touches
casual_dining.booking_tips: Part of a cultural complex with a bar, hotel, and event spaces. Courtyard is a highlight.
casual_dining.local_tips: Chic and popular spot for classic brasserie food in a beautifully designed space.

casual_dining.name: tibits
signature_dishes: Large buffet ('Food Boat') with diverse hot and cold vegetarian/vegan dishes (pay by weight)
casual_dining.booking_tips: Pay by weight. Great variety for vegetarians and vegans. Also offers breakfast and weekend brunch.
casual_dining.local_tips: Very popular and reliable choice for high-quality vegetarian/vegan food in a casual setting.

casual_dining.name: Za Zaa - Lebanese Soul Food
signature_dishes: Mezze platters (various dips like hummus, baba ghanoush, muhammara)
casual_dining.booking_tips: Focuses primarily on vegetarian Lebanese cuisine. Good for sharing.
casual_dining.local_tips: Flavorful Lebanese vegetarian food, great for mezze and sharing.

street_food.name: Markthalle Basel
specialties: Huge variety of international food stalls: Asian (Thai, Vietnamese, Japanese), Italian, Afghan, Ethiopian, South American (Arepas), Swiss, etc.
Burgers, Pizza, Fish & Chips, Dumplings, Curries
street_food.hours: Daily for lunch and dinner (individual stall hours vary)
street_food.seating: Large communal seating area inside the historic market hall dome
street_food.local_tips: Basel's main indoor food market. Great choice if everyone wants something different. Lively atmosphere, also has bars. Weekly Sunday brunch ('Zmorgeland').

street_food.name: KLARA
specialties: Food court concept with diverse kitchens: Mexican (La Taqueria), Ethiopian/Senegalese (AfroLicious), Indian, Vietnamese, Italian, etc.
street_food.hours: Typically Lunch & Dinner (check specific kitchen hours)
street_food.seating: Communal seating inside the food court
street_food.local_tips: Similar concept to Markthalle but in Kleinbasel. Good variety of international food stands in a casual setting.

street_food.name: Marktplatz Stalls
specialties: Variable stalls, often including sausages (Klöpfer, Bratwurst)
street_food.hours: Mainly daytime, coinciding with the market
street_food.local_tips: Grab a quick bite while visiting the main market square. Sausage stalls are a classic Swiss street food experience.

street_food.name: Food Trucks (various locations)
specialties: Varies: Burgers, Tacos, Curries, Pizza, etc.
street_food.hours: Often lunchtime near office areas or specific events/locations.
street_food.location: Various - check local listings or apps
street_food.local_tips: Look out for food trucks near business districts during lunch or at festivals/events.

coffee_shops.name: Unternehmen Mitte
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Unique, vast space in a former bank hall, bohemian, lively, workspace-friendly
coffee_shops.best_time: Anytime, popular for working/studying or meeting friends
coffee_shops.local_tips: Iconic Basel meeting place. Grand setting, often busy. Order at the counter. Also hosts events.

coffee_shops.name: Confiserie Schiesser
must_try: Fine pastries, cakes (e.g., Black Forest Gateau)
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Traditional, old-world charm, elegant upstairs tea room with views of Marktplatz
coffee_shops.food_options: Pastries, cakes, chocolates, light savory snacks
coffee_shops.local_tips: Basel's oldest confiserie (since 1870). Great spot for traditional cakes and chocolates with a view.

coffee_shops.name: Kaffeemacher
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Modern, focused on coffee quality, knowledgeable baristas
coffee_shops.local_tips: One of Basel's top spots for third-wave specialty coffee enthusiasts. They roast their own beans.

coffee_shops.name: Restaurant Café Papiermühle
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Charming setting next to the Paper Mill Museum, streamside courtyard, cozy interior
coffee_shops.best_time: Lunch or afternoon break when visiting the museum/St. Alban valley
coffee_shops.food_options: Cakes, quiches, salads, pasta, daily specials
coffee_shops.local_tips: Lovely cafe in the picturesque St. Alban district, perfect after visiting the Paper Mill Museum.

coffee_shops.name: frühling
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Hip, bright, modern, popular brunch spot
coffee_shops.local_tips: Popular neighborhood cafe known for good coffee and brunch menus. Can get busy on weekends.

bars.name: Consum Weinbar
signature_drinks: Large selection of European wines by the glass or bottle
bars.atmosphere: Cozy, intimate, rustic-chic, popular with locals
bars.food_options: High-quality cheese and charcuterie platters, tapas-style bites
bars.local_tips: Excellent wine bar in Kleinbasel with a great selection and knowledgeable staff. Perfect for wine lovers.

bars.name: Volkshaus Bar
signature_drinks: Well-crafted cocktails, good selection of spirits and wines
bars.atmosphere: Stylish, elegant design by Herzog & de Meuron, sophisticated yet relaxed
bars.food_options: Bar snacks, small plates from the brasserie
bars.reservation_needed: Not usually needed for the bar
bars.local_tips: Chic bar within the Volkshaus complex. Great for cocktails in a beautifully designed setting.

bars.name: Cargo Bar
bars.specialty: Drinks with a View, Cultural Events
bars.atmosphere: Casual, alternative, cultural hub, large terrace directly on the Rhine
bars.local_tips: Popular spot right on the Rhine promenade, known for its terrace, cultural events (readings, concerts), and relaxed vibe.

bars.name: Bar Rouge
bars.atmosphere: Sleek, modern, stunning views from the top of the Messeturm (Trade Fair Tower)
bars.reservation_needed: Recommended, especially weekends (can have a dress code/entry fee later at night)
bars.local_tips: Offers the best panoramic views of Basel from the city's tallest building. Transforms into more of a club atmosphere later in the evening.

bars.name: Nomad Bar (Nomad Hotel)
signature_drinks: Craft cocktails, local beers, good wine selection
bars.atmosphere: Modern design, urban oasis feel, library corner, lively
bars.local_tips: Stylish hotel bar that's also popular with non-guests. Good food options make it suitable for a casual dinner too.

food_tours.name: Basel Food & Culture Tour
highlights: Sampling local cheeses and cured meats
Learning about Basel's culinary history and traditions
food_tours.booking_tips: Several local operators offer food tours, often combined with city history. Check Basel Tourism website or platforms like Viator/GetYourGuide. Book in advance.

cooking_classes.name: Basler Läckerli Baking Workshop
what_you_learn: Mixing, rolling, baking, and glazing techniques
includes: Hands-on baking, ingredients, resulting Läckerli to take home
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Look for workshops offered by Läckerli Huus or local cooking schools, especially around holiday seasons. Book ahead.

cooking_classes.name: Swiss Chocolate Making Experience
what_you_learn: Creating pralines, truffles, or chocolate bars
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Offered by some chocolatiers or cooking schools in Basel. Check availability and book in advance.

markets.name: Marktplatz Market
highlights: Fresh local and regional produce (fruits, vegetables)
Vibrant atmosphere in front of the Rathaus
markets.hours: Mon-Sat (approx. 7 AM - 2 PM, some stalls longer/shorter)
markets.best_time: Weekday mornings for best selection and atmosphere
markets.local_tips: Basel's main traditional outdoor market. Great for fresh produce, flowers, and experiencing local life.

markets.name: Markthalle Basel
highlights: Wide array of international street food stalls
markets.hours: Daily for lunch & dinner (stall hours vary)
markets.best_time: Lunch or casual dinner, especially for groups with diverse tastes
markets.local_tips: A modern food hub in a historic building. Excellent variety, lively atmosphere.

markets.name: Matthäusmarkt
highlights: Focus on local, organic, and artisan products
Fresh produce, bread, cheese, meat, flowers
Smaller, neighborhood feel compared to Marktplatz
markets.local_tips: Popular neighborhood market in Kleinbasel, known for quality local goods and a friendly atmosphere.

spring: Bärlauch (Wild Garlic / Ramsons) - used in soups, pesto, etc.
summer: Frische Beeren (Fresh Berries - Strawberries, Raspberries, Blueberries)
Zander / Egli (Pikeperch / Perch) - often served fried ('Fischknusperli')
autumn: Wild (Game meat - Hirsch/Venison, Reh/Roe Deer, Wildschwein/Wild Boar)
Mässmogge (Sugar candies filled with hazelnut praline - specific to Herbstmesse fair, Oct/Nov)
winter: Basler Läckerli (Traditional gingerbread biscuit - available year-round but especially popular)
Hypokras (Spiced wine - often at Christmas markets)
Fasnachtskiechli (Thin fried pastries - during Fasnacht/Carnival season, Feb/Mar)
